content: chick / crow / bird - amigurumi pattern by criss wall i have a huge collection of scrap balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them i know that there are a lot lovely bird patterns out there already but some of them take quite some time to finish i am not a fan of sewing/joining on bits after the body is done i wanted to create a small series of patterns that take around 30-40 mins to complete and do not involve sewing additional parts onto the work after it is finished for this pattern the wings are crocheted into the work and the beak & legs are simply tied together on the inside of the body before it is stuffed there are two patterns here a large bird and a smaller version my pattern contains basic instructions meant for someone who is already familiar crocheting amigurumi the pictures in my instructions are of the large bird materials  you will need 8-9mm safety eyes stuffing a needle and two sizes of crochet hooks  yarn of two different colours of your choice  for 8ply/dk yarn i use a 3 50mm and for 10ply/aran i use a 4 00mm hook stitches  chain  slip_stitch slip_stitch  single_crochet single_crochet  half_double_crochet half_double_crochet  double_crochet double_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  back loop work in the back loop stitch only criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/easy-chick-crow-bird large chick instructions you need to crochet the beak wings and feet first i have photos at the end of the pattern for your reference beak the beak is only one row using the alternative colour crochet the following into a magic_ring single_crochet slip_stitch into the top of the first single_crochet or complete an invisible finish cut the yarn leaving a tail and pull through secure this thread at this corner and leave the tail pulled through to the back for the other thread pull the magic_ring closed and tie off thread the magic_ring thread end through the middle to the other side of the beak you now have two threads on either side of the beak this is what we will use to tie the beak to the head you can shape the beak by folding it over on itself and gently tugging out on the 2 x double_crochet s wings x 2 use either the main or
